column5: How are you guys doing with roll up the rim so far? I am 3 wins (coffees) for 6
Guess I'll have to buy my prize... don't patronize the place.
I don't buy coffee there that often, but from the ones I bought recently,  It's a big zero for me
I'm zero for twelve...............
I'm 1 for 5...i won a donut this morning.

If you've won three times already you are spending too much on coffee. An extra large a day will cost about $45.00/month, put that money in an index fund (low MER, safe) and when the TSX is back up around 14000 points you will have almost doubled your money. Buy a dividend fund that holds lots of bank stocks and you might do even better. Jim
0 for 2 here. I gave up on this already. Might as well save the money and buy myself a few more crankbaits this coming season
I've had 4-5 cups since it started, haven't won a thing.
I'm 1 for 2 (free coffee). I'm hoping to win one of those $10,000 prizes.. that would buy a hell of a lot of fishing tackle..
I am a 2 cups a day guy.  12-14/week - 52 weeks a year - every year.  Don't care to do the math but I  have never won even a dang muffin at that contest.  I think I am due.
2 for 12 both donuts but 10g's would be nice
1 out of maybe 3 or 4?

2 out of 3 so far....Its the only time i order an XL....LOL...When i win a freebie...My son bought my 1st one when it started which was a winner then i got another three days later and another winner......Used that today and won...Please play again....
I haven't bought a coffee there ever. My $4.99 tub of Folgers from Walmart nets me about 300 cups or so. 300 cups from Timmies = $500.00??? Just doesn't make sense to me.
$625-725 a year in coffee.   I like the Folgers idea. Hell they even sell the coffee cans at tim hortons too. You can play online now aswell.
1 for 5.

Ditto, though I don't shop Walmart.  I actually have a $25 Timmies gift card in my wallet (Christmas gift) that I haven't used and Lord knows if I ever will? Praps on some wayward trip to Nipigon or something.
now 1 for 6 and i don't even drink coffee

lol... I agree, huge waste of money (I use to do it everyday).  Since I work from home, I started drinking maxwell to save money but I actually now buy the tins of Tim Hortons coffee, I just like the taste better but I'm still saving a ton of money.
1 free coffee so far..That makes it 1 fer 2...My wife won the "Coleman Camper" prize couple years back....
